description.narrative: The key development objective of this project is to increase financial inclusion in Georgia. The project is designed to improve access to finance for the underserved segment of SMEs in Georgia by providing capital support needed by Bank of Georgia to expand their lending operations.

The proposed investment consists of up to a US$65 million subordinated debt to Bank of Georgia (BoG or the Bank), which is expected to be funded fully through the IFC Capitalization Fund (the Cap Fund), as the proposed project is fully consistent with the Cap Funds objective of supporting a systemic bank that is capable of providing credit to emerging economies but is facing significant challenges to raise capital in international capital/credit markets, due to the global financial crisis. The proposed investment intends to strengthen BoGs balance sheet by expanding its capital base, as well as support its growth strategy,
